channel.title: Posts on Non-volatile Memory
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Non-volatile Memory

item.title: Manage AWS Saml Roles for G Suite Users
item.description: I recently setup G Suite (aka Google Apps for Work) as the SAML IdP for my personal AWS account following these instructions. Once it was done, I had a very simple way to log into my AWS console using my existing G Suite credentials. Now I no longer need to remember my IAM user password (well, it was in a password manager, but it’s one less thing) and I get the additional benefit of my G Suite-configured MFA settings.

item.title: habits
item.description: It’s time I started a blog and actually wrote a few things down, if only to help clarify my thoughts and better remember the things I learn. While I hope some of what I write will be useful to others, if it’s not that will be OK. I plan to mostly write about the cloud and software. So, let’s give it a shot. What could go wrong? The word blog used to bother me quite a bit.
